avalancheActivity.highlights: Intense snowfall fell in E-winds on Thursday that could have formed wind slabs in W-facing hills. The new snow could be unstable to begin with.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Short but intense snowfall occured on Thursday in strong E-winds. Binding with the older snow will likely be weak to begin with and western facing hills could be especially dangerous as wind slabs likely formed. Snow melted away widely in the warming episode last week and froze again so that snow has gotten stiff and stable. This older snowpack is therefore likely homogenous and strong.

travelAdvisory.comment:
Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger has been declared for South Iceland. South Iceland will experience an easterly storm with avalanche danger in Mýrdalur, where the precipitation is most intense. This will go on until the morning and avalanche danger will likely occur in known areas of Mýrdalur. Other parts of the region are not expected to experience much avalanche danger. Forecasts predict that by morning, precipitation stops, winds slow down followed by slight warming up to freezing.
Wind slabs and weak layers are present in N- and E- Iceland. Avalanches have released on interface between new snow and older firn where weakness is widespread in North and East parts.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger has been declared for South Iceland. South Iceland will experience an Easterly storm with avalanche danger in Mýrdalur especially.

weatherForecast.highlights: Austan hvassviðri en úrkomulaust verður á föstudag en búist er við éljabökkum og hlýindum með laugardeginum í hægum suðlægum áttum. Hiti gæti náð allt að 5 stigum á láglendi áður en frystir aftur.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Thin covering of snow is on top of older snow, which is considered stable. Small windslabs could form on variable aspects in the next few days.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Little snow is in the area, widely just a thin cover of snow on top of older snow which is considered stable. The new snow might have formed small windslabs, mainly on southwesterly aspects, but variable winds in the next few days might move snow to other aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment:

South Iceland will experience an easterly storm with avalanche danger in Mýrdalur, where the precipitation is most intense. This will go on until the morning and avalanche danger will likely occur in known areas of Mýrdalur. Other parts of the region are not expected to experience much avalanche danger. weatherForecast.highlights: Breytilegar vindáttir næstu daga og dálítil snjókoma. Áfram kalt í veðri en hlýnar örlítið á laugardag.

avalancheActivity.comment: 3 wet avalanches fell in Héðinsfjörður likely in the warm episode of last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Considerable snow fell on Tuesday in strong N-winds. Snow formed wind-slabs in various hill facies and the new snow will likely be unstable throughout the weekend. Faceting has likely occured in the snowpack due to intense frost. Some snowfall will continue throughout the week with warming on Saturday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: It snowed in strong N-winds throughout Tuesday and wind slabs formed in S-facing hills, the new snow is likely unstable to begin with. The older snow has been through melt-freeze cycles and is widely considered stable. Intense frost has been throughout the week and especially high in the mountains were some faceting could have occured in the snowpack in weaker layers. Snowpit was taken in NE facing hill in Siglufjörður on Wednesday that confirmed a steep temperature gradient and a weak layer of faceted crystals at a depth of 55 cm. Woomp sounds occured widely and the snowpack is considered unstable at various places.

Forecasts predict that by morning, precipitation stops, winds slow down followed by slight warming up to freezing.

weatherForecast.highlights: Lítilsháttar snjókoma heldur áfram út vikuna með mestri ákefð um fimmtudagskvöld í norðan áttum. Hvessir snemma á laugardag en suðvestlægir éljabakkar eru síðan líklegir út helgina. Hitastig gæti farið í -20 upp til fjalla.

avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow is in the area. It has likely formed windslabs on most aspects. Intense snowfall the night before Saturday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The new snow has probably fromed windslabs on most aspects which could be unstable to begin with. Temporary considerable snowfall is forecasted the night before Saturday. Isolated weak layers could still be present at high elevations.

Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger has been declared for South Iceland. South Iceland will experience an easterly storm with avalanche danger in Mýrdalur, where the precipitation is most intense. weatherForecast.highlights: Dregur úr vindi á föstudag en vaxandi A-átt aðfaranótt laugardags, A 8-13 m/s um tíma með snjókomu en dregur úr úrkomu og vindi með morgninum. Hlýnar á laugardag, hiti líklega yfir frostmarki á láglendi en frost til fjalla. Á sunnudag er útlit fyrir hæglætisveður.
